items.title: Vitalik Buterin sold 17,000 ETH this month as ether fell 37%
items.summary: The Ethereum co-founder's tracked wallets dropped from 241,000 ETH to 224,000 ETH in February, with sales routed through CoW Protocol in small batches to limit market impact.

items.title: Crypto firm with U.S. bank charter holds bitcoin holder Strategy's preferred stock
items.summary: Anchorage Digital, the first federally chartered U.S. crypto bank, has added perpetual preferred stock in bitcoin treasury firm Strategy to its balance sheet.

items.title: Dogecoin jumps 5% as breakout flips resistance into support
items.summary: The token is consolidating around $0.0940–$0.0945 with higher lows, signaling constructive momentum after the breakout.

items.title: Bitcoin adoption is booming, even if its price isn’t: River
items.summary: River reports that Bitcoin adoption surged in 2025, cementing it as a mature asset class, even as its price has halved since hitting a peak in October.

items.title: Coinbase CEO Pushes Back on UK Stablecoin Caps as Token Profits Surge
items.summary: The proposal would cap stablecoin holdings and curb yields, a move critics say could push liquidity overseas as stablecoins become a core revenue stream.

items.title: South Korean man faces jail over alleged poisoning over crypto trading losses
items.summary: South Korean prosecutors reportedly accused a man of poisoning a business partner with pesticide in a dispute over losses due to crypto trading.

items.title: Bitcoin bounces above $65,000 as dollar weakens and bullish hopes build
items.summary: A broad uptick across tokens arrived alongside a softer greenback and a rally in Asian equities, though analysts remain split on whether the Feb. 5 lows will hold.

items.title: Bitcoin Ticks Higher as Markets Weigh Trump Address, Broader Risk Sentiment
items.summary: Bitcoin remains sensitive to broader risk sentiment, with traders positioning ahead of Nvidia’s earnings and a rebound in global stocks.

items.title: Bitcoin captures $65K after US stocks rebound from AI sell-off: Will it hold?
items.summary: Bitcoin rallied above $66,000 following a positive close from US stock markets, putting Monday’s AI and tech-stock driven sell-off to rest. Will $60,000 remain the BTC bottom?

items.title: Payoneer joins rush of fintechs bidding for US bank charters
items.summary: Coinbase, World Liberty Financial and Laser Digital are also in line for a banking charter in the US, after Crypto.com received conditional approval for a charter on Monday.

items.title: Bitcoin Depot to require ID for all transactions at its crypto ATMs
items.summary: Bitcoin Depot is moving to require ID for all transactions as regulators have cracked down on crypto ATM operators over scams and money laundering concerns.

items.title: Stripe considers acquiring some or all of PayPal: Report
items.summary: Bloomberg reports that Stripe is in early acquisition talks with PayPal as the payments giant has battled competition, leadership turmoil and an 85% stock drop from its peak.

items.title: Stripe in Early Talks on Potential PayPal Deal: Bloomberg
items.summary: The deal could combine two major payments firms already expanding into stablecoin and crypto infrastructure.

items.title: Crypto lobby Blockchain Association pitches tax plan to Congress
items.summary: The Blockchain Association released its tax policy positions, saying “low-dollar” crypto transfers should be exempted, but mining and staking should be taxed.

items.title: Anthropic says it's been targeted in massive distillation attacks
items.summary: Anthropic alleges Chinese AI companies DeepSeek, Moonshot and MiniMax made 24,000 accounts and 16 million Claude exchanges to scrape its AI bot for training.

items.title: Bitwise acquires Chorus One, potentially paving way for more staked ETFs
items.summary: Bitwise’s acquisition of Chorus One expands the company’s staking capabilities to more than 30 blockchains, including Solana, Hyperliquid, Monad, Avalanche and Sui.

items.title: Treasury Sanctions Russian ‘Exploit’ Broker Over Stolen US Cyber Tools
items.summary: It marks the first use of the Protecting American Intellectual Property Act, targeting a firm accused of brokering stolen U.S. cyber tools.

items.title: Coinbase, Kraken and Binance Push Deeper Into Tokenization as Capital Shifts
items.summary: Tokenized real-world assets have continued to expand despite a broader market slide, with assets distributed on-chain up nearly 300% year over year.

items.title: ETH options turn bearish as traders prepare for extended Ether price downside
items.summary: Ether faces a bearish trend as onchain fees and network deposits hit multiyear lows. Until derivatives metrics stabilize, ETH price remains at risk.

items.title: Bitcoin Depot Will Require ID for 'Every Transaction' at ATMs Amid Growing Pressure
items.summary: Bitcoin Depot will begin verifying customers’ identities each time they use its ATMs, voluntarily refining its compliance procedures.

items.title: ESMA warns crypto perpetual derivatives likely fall under CFD rules
items.summary: The EU authority tracking compliance under the MiCA framework issued a warning to those marketing crypto derivatives as “perpetual futures or perpetual contracts.”

items.title: Crypto wallets for AI agents are creating a new legal frontier, says Electric Capital
items.summary: As AI agents grow more autonomous, developers are already giving them crypto wallets, allowing software to hold assets, pay for services, trade tokens and even hire other agents. The technical pieces are falling into place. The legal ones …

items.title: Payments giant Stripe reportedly mulling PayPal acquisition. Here is what it means for crypto
items.summary: Bloomberg reported that Stripe — which has growing stablecoin and blockchain ambitions — is exploring a deal for the embattled fintech.

items.title: Coinbase opens stock and ETF trading to all US users in multi-asset push
items.summary: The exchange now allows US customers to trade thousands of stocks and ETFs commission-free alongside crypto, with 24/5 access and instant funding.

items.title: Kraken debuts tokenized stock perpetual futures for non-US traders
items.summary: Kraken’s new contracts, built on the xStocks framework, offer up to 20x leverage on tokenized benchmarks tied to US equities and gold.

items.title: MoonPay launches ‘Agents,’ giving AI systems wallets and onchain cash flow
items.summary: MoonPay debuts infrastructure enabling AI agents to transact with stablecoins onchain as both crypto and non-crypto companies race to build the “agent economy.”

items.title: OpenAI Says Benchmark Used to Measure AI Coding Skill Is 'Contaminated'—Here's Why
items.summary: OpenAI wants to retire the leading AI coding benchmark—and the reasons reveal a deeper problem with how the whole industry measures itself.

items.title: Bitwise's Hunter Horsley says AI Is ‘unstoppable freight train’ for crypto, while Haun’s Monica urges caution
items.summary: As artificial intelligence races ahead, some crypto executives believe it could become the force that finally pushes blockchain infrastructure into widespread use. Others aren’t convinced the leap is so straightforward.

items.title: 'Stablecoin Summer': Stripe Makes Tender Offer at $159 Billion Valuation
items.summary: Payments giant Stripe made a tender offer valuing the firm at $159 billion as payments and stablecoin volumes rise.

items.title: After Donating $35 Million to Trump PAC, Crypto.com Scores Wins From Regulators
items.summary: Weeks after giving another $5 million to a pro-Trump PAC, the exchange received lawsuit aid from the CFTC and a bank charter from the Treasury Department.

items.title: South Korean Man Faces Murder Charge Over Bitcoin Bet Gone Bad
items.summary: Prosecutors in Seoul say a man poisoned his business partner after the colleague mismanaged his Bitcoin investments.

items.title: Crypto isn't losing to AI, its just 'capitalism doing its job,' says Dragonfly
items.summary: Comparisons between AI’s explosive consumer adoption and crypto’s trajectory misunderstand the nature of the products, Dragonfly's Haseeb Qureshi told CoinDesk in an interview.

items.title: Crypto’s biggest exchange fights back against allegations of moving billions of Iran-linked money
items.summary: The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times and Fortune all reported that investigators had been let go after identifying sanctions-violating transactions.

items.title: Key Bitcoin onchain signal may mark BTC’s next demand revival
items.summary: Bitcoin remains pinned below $65,000 as random bouts of intense selling pressure persist, but one onchain indicator has stabilized, providing insight into when spot market demand may return.

items.title: Polymarket users favor Meteora in bets over ZachXBT crypto takedown
items.summary: Users placed more than $7 million betting on the outcome of the crypto sleuth's investigation, expected to be announced on Thursday.

items.title: Millions in crypto funded tools to exploit U.S. software, Treasury says in new sanctions
items.summary: An Australian national was said to sell cyber tools designed for the U.S. government and its allies to a Russian company known as Operation Zero.

items.title: Solo Bitcoin Miner Nabs $200K After Renting $75 Worth of Hash Power
items.summary: Despite incredibly long odds, someone scored a $200K BTC block reward after spending just $75 to rent Bitcoin mining power.

items.title: Longest Ether dip since 2022 ignored by whales: What’s next for ETH?
items.summary: Ether whale order sizes are shrinking, while a $2 billion short cluster near $2,000 frame a tightening liquidity scenario for ETH after a sixth week of red price action.

items.title: Empery Digital shareholder demands sale of 4,000-plus Bitcoin treasury, resignations
items.summary: A 9.8% shareholder has doubled down on calls for Empery Digital to sell its BTC holdings, return capital to investors and remove its CEO and board.

items.title: Fed proposes rule to deal with crypto debanking by scrapping 'reputation risk'
items.summary: The proposal would cut the risk factor from Fed oversight and bar supervisors from pushing banks to cut off disfavored businesses, including in crypto.

items.title: Prediction market firms could be making $10 billion in yearly revenue by 2030, Citizens Bank says
items.summary: The bank said rising volumes, tighter market structure and early institutional engagement are pushing prediction markets beyond their gambling roots toward a new asset class.

items.title: WisdomTree Gets SEC Nod to Enable Instant Settlement for Tokenized Money Market Fund
items.summary: WisdomTree is enabling instant settlement for its tokenized money market fund, indicating its product won't be limited by Wall Street’s pace.

items.title: Bitcoin retakes $64,000, crypto miners rally, as AI-related software rout eases
items.summary: Sellers are taking a breather as bitcoin's Fear & Greed Index plunged to levels never seen before.

items.title: WisdomTree gets SEC approval for round-the-clock trading of tokenized MMF
items.summary: The approval allows WisdomTree’s tokenized Treasury money market fund to trade and settle around the clock within the US regulatory framework.

items.title: Binance CEO accuses WSJ of defamation over Iran sanctions report
items.summary: Two major news outlets published similar reports on Monday claiming that Binance had fired or suspended employees involved in an investigation into crypto going to Iranian entities.

items.summary: The payments giant says Bridge, its stablecoin arm, saw its transaction volume sky-rocket through last year as stablecoin adoption is decoupling from crypto cycles.

items.title: Trump’s White House Has One View of Crypto Legislation. His Family’s Crypto Company Has Another
items.summary: World Liberty Financial is backing Coinbase on the crypto market structure bill debate, even as the White House criticizes the company.

items.title: Ethereum Foundation Starts Staking Treasury Amid Vitalik Buterin's ETH Sales
items.summary: The Ethereum Foundation began staking ETH as part of new treasury operations amid a string of sales from co-founder Vitalik Buterin.

items.title: Bitcoin Traders Expect More Pain Ahead After BTC Falls 50% From Peak
items.summary: Bitcoin dropped below the $63,000 mark overnight, falling more than 50% from its October peak as traders project a further dip ahead.

items.title: Bitcoin’s U.S. demand signal turns negative for a record 40 days
items.summary: The indicator last printed positive on Jan. 15. Its failure to fully recover after a Feb. 5 rebound suggests U.S. demand remains structurally absent rather than temporarily paused.

items.title: Mark Zuckerberg's Meta is planning stablecoin comeback in the second half of this year
items.summary: The Facebook owner’s stablecoin integration involves a third party vendor to help administer stablecoin-based payments and a new wallet to be implemented, sources said.

items.title: Binance brings back tokenized stocks trading with Ondo Finance deal
items.summary: The world’s largest crypto exchange has listed a batch of tokenized U.S. equities issued by Ondo Finance on its Binance Alpha platform, reviving stock trading push.

items.title: Solana DeFi Project Step Finance to Wind Down Weeks After $29M Hack
items.summary: The Solana projects made the "difficult decision" to cease operations after January's treasury breach and subsequent failed rescue efforts.

items.summary: Ethereum is going back to its cypherpunk ethos with FOCIL—but it could create compliance issues down the line.

items.title: Bitcoin's Path to Recovery 'Unclear' Amid Macro Headwinds
items.summary: Bitcoin has flashed rare bottom signals, but macro headwinds are keeping a sustained recovery at bay, analysts told Decrypt.
